  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public static void setUp()
      Create 10 mazes of varying difficulty for ease of testing. This makes it so tests don't have to remake mazes multiple times. Do not do skill levels a-f because it would be too expensive to create them.

    • testHasExit

      public void testHasExit()
      Test Case: Check if maze has an exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, simply go to check if the floor plan that should have been made has an exit somewhere within the maze. Goes around border of the maze until it finds an opening to the exterior of the maze, meaning there is no wallboard present.
      Overrides:
      testHasExit in class MazeFactoryTest

    • testHasOnlyOneExit

      public void testHasOnlyOneExit()
      Test Case: Check if maze has only one exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, make sure the floorplan only has one opening to the exterior of the maze, and no more. Goes around border of the maze trying to find an opening to the exterior of the maze, meaning there is no wallboard present. Counts how many times it succeeds, and passes if only once, fails if more.
      Overrides:
      testHasOnlyOneExit in class MazeFactoryTest

    • testAllHaveDistance

      public void testAllHaveDistance()
      Test Case: Check if maze has only one exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, makes sure that all cells have a distance from the exit, meaning that they are all reachable in some way. Can use this by checking the dists attribute in MazeFactory's builder attribute.
      Overrides:
      testAllHaveDistance in class MazeFactoryTest

      public void testInterruption() throws IOException
      Test Case: Check how builder handles cancelling an order Routine being tested: order, dbg Tests if maze building handles errors that we expect when we halt the building process. Tests no exceptions are thrown, meaning it is handled correctly
      Throws:
      IOException
